page.title: 07 Linlithgow Marches
page.content: The Riding of the{Marches}is when Magistrates and Burgesses set out to inspect the boundaries of Linlithgow The first Tuesday after the second Thursday in June is the actual riding inspection and this day plus the next are a local holiday.This tradition has been taking place in Linlithgow since 1540.Today the{Marches}is a bright and colourful procession full of parading clubs and bands. People who are born in Linlithgow are called{Black Bitches.}This name takes its meaning from the story of the dog that was chained to a tree in the middle of Linlithgow Loch.This story of the Black Bitch happened in the reign of Mary Queen of Scots. Black Bitches try to return to Linlithgow to celebrate the Marches whenever possible.
